title: Information processing via human soft tissue. (arXiv:2305.14366v1 [q-bio.NC])
abstract: This study demonstrates that the soft biological tissues of humans can be used as a type of soft body in physical reservoir computing. Soft biological tissues possess characteristics such as stress-strain nonlinearity and viscoelasticity that satisfy the requirements for physical reservoir computing, including nonlinearity and memory. The aim of this study was to utilize the dynamics of human soft tissues as a physical reservoir for the emulation of nonlinear dynamical systems. To demonstrate this concept, joint angle data during motion in the flexion-extension direction of the wrist joint, and ultrasound images of the muscles associated with that motion, were acquired from human participants. The input to the system was the angle of the wrist joint, while the deformation field within the muscle (obtained from ultrasound images) represented the state of the reservoir. translated_title: 通过人体软组织进行信息处理
translated_abstract: 本研究表明，人体软组织可被用作物理储备计算中的软体。软生物组织具有应力应变非线性和粘弹性等特性，满足物理储备计算的要求，包括非线性和记忆。本研究旨在利用人体软组织的动力学作为非线性动态系统仿真的物理储备。为了证明这个概念，从人体参与者中获取手腕关节的屈伸运动的关节角度数据和关联运动的肌肉的超声图像。系统的输入是手腕关节的角度，而肌肉内的变形场（从超声图像中获得）代表了储备的状态。结果表明，软组织的动力学对于通过物理储备计算来仿真非线性动态系统的计算任务具有积极的影响。
tldr: 本研究表明，人类的软组织可用于物理储备计算中的软体，在仿真非线性动态系统的计算任务中具有积极的影响。
en_tdlr: This study shows that human soft tissue can be used as a soft body in physical reservoir computing and has a positive impact on the computational task of emulating nonlinear dynamical systems.
